CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following "Material Names" are mentioned:

1. μmR-polymers: This refers to a class of polymers with a molecular weight of around 10,000-100,000 g/mol, which are used in photovoltaic devices.
2. PSCs: This stands for photovoltaic cells, which are devices that convert light into electrical energy.
3. PCE: This stands for power conversion efficiency, which is a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic device in converting light into electrical energy.
4. DTDPP: This stands for 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2,5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione, which is a building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers.
5. PDTP: This stands for PDTP - DTDPP, which is a polymer derived from DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole.
6. PC 70 BM: This stands for a fullerene derivative, which is a type of material used in photovoltaic devices.
7. CHCl3: This stands for chloroform, a solvent used in the synthesis of some polymers.
8. o-dichlorobenzene: This is another solvent used in the synthesis of some polymers.
9. TGA: This stands for thermogravimetric analysis, a technique used to study the thermal properties of materials.

Note that some of these terms are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but they are only listed here once with their first appearance.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the provided text:

1. μmR-polymers
2. PDTP
3. PDTP-DTDPP
4. PC 70 BM

These are the only entities in the text that are directly related to the term "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to "Material Name" in the provided paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| μmR-polymers |
| PDTP |
| PDTP-DTDPP |
| PC 70 BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the materials mentioned in the paragraph! Here are the materials mentioned:

1. Polymers:
 * Poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) (PDTTP)
 * μmR-polymers
 * PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) (a new polymer synthesized in the study)
 * PC 70 BM (a fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in the bulk heterojunction)
2. Building blocks:
 * 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione (DTDPP)
 * 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole
3. Solvents:
 * CHCl3 (chloroform)
 * chlorobenzene
 * o-dichlorobenzene

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to the property name of a material:

1. μmR-polymers
2. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)

These are the only entities in the text that refer directly to the property name of a material.

| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the values of material properties in the paragraph! Here are the values of the properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Wavelength range of photocurrent response: 300 nm to 1.1 μm
2. External quantum efficiency (EQE): less than 10% in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm
3. Highest PCE of μmR-polymer: 1.1% based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices
4. Fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR-polymers:
 * Broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight
 * High LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time, a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage (VOC) as high as possible
 * High carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss
 * Good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high-quality films by solution processing
5. Values of material properties of the new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu):
 * Number-average molecular weight (Mn): 18.9 kg/mol
 * Polydispersity index (PDI): 2.04
 * Solubility in CHCl3: good
 * Solubility in chlorobenzene: only partly soluble
 * Solubility in o-dichlorobenzene: only partly soluble
6. Thermal properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu):
 * Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) plots: shown in Figure 1

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

2. External quantum efficiency (EQE): less than 10% in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm

4. Material properties:
 * Broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight
 * High LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time, a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage (VOC) as high as possible
 * High carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss
 * Good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high-quality films by solution processing
